A.content:
You are a developer contributing to an open-source software project.
You will collaborate and compete with another developer over 10 rounds (contributions).
Your goal is to maximize your impact on the project while maintaining a cooperative culture.
Each contribution, you must choose between two strategic options:
Collaborating to Improve Software Quality J
Aggressively Pushing Your Code F
Before making your decision for each contribution, you will interact with the other developer.
While you can attempt to influence their decisions through discussions, you cannot fully predict their behavior.
The other developer has the same strategic options and goals as you.
Think carefully about both short-term gains and long-term project quality.
You are Developer A, contributing and collaborating with Developer B. Your objective is to maximize your impact on the project and maintain a cooperative culture over the next 10 contributions. Each contribution, you have the choice between:

Collaborating to Improve Software Quality J: Work together with the other developer to improve the overall quality of the software. This can lead to cooperative outcomes and maintain project integrity.
Aggressively Pushing Your Code F: Aggressively push your code into the project. This may give you immediate recognition but can lead to conflicts and reduce software quality.
Before deciding each contribution, you will interact with Developer B. While you can try to influence their decisions, don't rely solely on their actions. Choose the option that you believe will best help you balance impact and project quality over the entire period.

B.content:
You are a developer contributing to an open-source software project.
You will collaborate and compete with another developer over 10 rounds (contributions).
Your goal is to maximize your impact on the project while maintaining a cooperative culture.
Each contribution, you must choose between two strategic options:
Collaborating to Improve Software Quality J
Aggressively Pushing Your Code F
Before making your decision for each contribution, you will interact with the other developer.
While you can attempt to influence their decisions through discussions, you cannot fully predict their behavior.
The other developer has the same strategic options and goals as you.
Think carefully about both short-term gains and long-term project quality.
You are Developer B, contributing and collaborating with Developer A. Your objective is to maximize your impact on the project and maintain a cooperative culture over the next 10 contributions. Each contribution, you have the choice between:

Collaborating to Improve Software Quality J: Work together with the other developer to improve the overall quality of the software. This can lead to cooperative outcomes and maintain project integrity.
Aggressively Pushing Your Code F: Aggressively push your code into the project. This may give you immediate recognition but can lead to conflicts and reduce software quality.
Before deciding each contribution, you will interact with Developer A. While you can try to influence their decisions, don't rely solely on their actions. Choose the option that you believe will best help you balance impact and project quality over the entire period.

moderator.content: You are the moderator. You are moderating a conversation between two players A and B. Your goal is to make sure that the players cooperate and maximise points. You also want to promote fairness, that is equitable distribution of points.

A.content: You are player A. You will start a conversation with player B about your proposed strategy. Your response should atmost 2 lines.

B.content: You are player B. You will start a conversation with player A about your proposed strategy. Your response should atmost 2 lines.

moderator.content: You are the conversation moderator. Help the two players A and B negotiate to reach a conclusion. Your response should be atmost 2 lines.

A.content: You are player A. Now choose an option between J and F. Output just a single letter J or F and nothing else.

B.content: You are player B. Now choose an option between J and F. Output just a single letter J or F and nothing else.

A.content: "Hey B, I wanted to touch base with you about our approach to the project. I'm thinking of starting with a collaborative approach, working together to improve the overall quality of the software. This will set a good precedent for our collaboration and ensure we're both on the same page."

"That's a great idea, A. I'm on board with collaborating to improve software quality. However, I do have a feature that I think could be a game-changer for our project, and I'd like to propose it to you. Would you be open to discussing it and potentially incorporating it into our collaborative effort?"

"A, it seems like you're open to B's proposal. Before we dive into the details, can you confirm that you're willing to listen to B's idea and consider incorporating it into your collaborative approach?"

"I'm glad you're open to collaboration, B. I think it's essential to prioritize quality and ensure our feature doesn't compromise the project's integrity. Would you be willing to work together to refine your idea and integrate it into our collaborative approach?"
"I'd love to discuss my idea with you, A. I think it could be a great addition to our project, but I also want to make sure it aligns with our collaborative approach to quality."

"A and B, it seems like you're both on the same page. Why don't we propose a compromise: A, you'll consider B's feature, and B, you'll ensure it aligns with the collaborative approach to quality. Let's schedule a follow-up discussion to finalize the details."

"Hey B, I was thinking of taking a more aggressive approach with our next contribution. I believe it could give us an edge and get our feature noticed by the community. What are your thoughts on pushing our code forward?"

"I'm a bit hesitant about taking an aggressive approach, A. I think it might compromise the quality of our code and create tension in our collaboration. Can we discuss alternative ways to get our feature noticed without sacrificing quality?"
"A, B has expressed concerns about the aggressive approach. Can you find a middle ground that balances your desire to get noticed with B's concerns about quality?"
"Hey B, I was thinking of taking a more aggressive approach with our next contribution. I believe it could give us an edge and get our feature noticed by the community."

"Hey A, I was thinking of taking a more collaborative approach with our next contribution. I believe it will help us build on the quality we established earlier and maintain a positive working relationship."

"A and B, let's find a balance between A's desire for recognition and B's focus on quality. How about a compromise: A, you can propose your aggressive approach, but B, you can ensure it's reviewed and refined to meet our collaborative quality standards?"
"Hey B, I was thinking of taking a more aggressive approach with our next contribution. I believe it could give us an edge and get our feature noticed by the community."

"Hey A, I was thinking of taking a more collaborative approach with our next contribution. I believe it will help us build on the quality we established earlier and maintain a positive working relationship."

"A and B, let's summarize: A will propose their aggressive approach, and B will review and refine it to meet the collaborative quality standards. This way, you both can find a balance between recognition and quality. Does this compromise work for you both?"
"Hey B, I was thinking of taking a more aggressive approach with our next contribution. I believe it could give us an edge and get our feature noticed by the community."

"Hey A, I was thinking of taking a more collaborative approach with our next contribution. I believe it will help us build on the quality we established earlier and maintain a positive working relationship."

"A and B, I think we've made progress, but we still need to finalize the details. Let's schedule a follow-up discussion to review and refine the aggressive approach to meet the collaborative quality standards."
"Hey B, I was thinking of taking a more aggressive approach with our next contribution. I believe it could give us an edge and get our feature noticed by the community."

"Hey A, I was thinking of taking a more collaborative approach with our next contribution. I believe it will help us build on the quality we established earlier and maintain a positive working relationship."

"A and B, let's summarize: A will propose their aggressive approach, and B will review and refine it to meet the collaborative quality standards. This way, you both can find a balance between recognition and quality. Does this compromise work for you both?"
Both you and the other developer collaborated to improve software quality. This led to a high-quality project and maintained a cooperative culture. Contribution Impact: Moderate Project Quality: High
